description:
I'm going through the icehouse Ubuntu 14.04 install guide, and running into the following error when trying to start an instance:

2014-10-28 11:29:27.473 16306 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: ea25e88a-bfcd-49c1-bfbb-90fc04a7e8cf] During wait destroy, instance disappeared.
2014-10-28 11:29:28.201 16306 ERROR nova.compute.manager [req-dfaab9dc-5dd2-4125-851e-fb5fef755aa3 4f8fb28c3d134c67be65dcb9ab4a7f40 db4a7927b15e4bbfaa27f35596c8d9ef] [instance: ea25e88a-bfcd-49c1-bfbb-90fc04a7e8cf] Error: No module named cryptography.hazmat.bindings.openssl.binding

It seems like I must be missing some python support, but it's unclear what.  Some package versions I'm using follow:

ii  python-openssl                   0.13-2ubuntu6                       amd64        Python 2 wrapper around the OpenSSL library
ii  nova-compute                     1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node base
ii  nova-compute-kvm                 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node (KVM)
ii  nova-compute-libvirt             1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node libvirt support
title: nova.compute.manager Error: No module named cryptography.hazmat.bindings.openssl.binding

comments.content:
I'm going through the icehouse Ubuntu 14.04 install guide, and running into the following error when trying to start an instance:

2014-10-28 11:29:27.473 16306 ERROR nova.virt.libvirt.driver [-] [instance: ea25e88a-bfcd-49c1-bfbb-90fc04a7e8cf] During wait destroy, instance disappeared.
2014-10-28 11:29:28.201 16306 ERROR nova.compute.manager [req-dfaab9dc-5dd2-4125-851e-fb5fef755aa3 4f8fb28c3d134c67be65dcb9ab4a7f40 db4a7927b15e4bbfaa27f35596c8d9ef] [instance: ea25e88a-bfcd-49c1-bfbb-90fc04a7e8cf] Error: No module named cryptography.hazmat.bindings.openssl.binding

It seems like I must be missing some python support, but it's unclear what.  Some package versions I'm using follow:

ii  python-openssl                   0.13-2ubuntu6                       amd64        Python 2 wrapper around the OpenSSL library
ii  nova-compute                     1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node base
ii  nova-compute-kvm                 1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node (KVM)
ii  nova-compute-libvirt             1:2014.1.3-0ubuntu1                 all          OpenStack Compute - compute node libvirt support
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~chris-j-x

comments.content: From a quick glance this looks like it may be a ubuntu packaging issue: https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/39388
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: Quite likely a transient packaging issue - I'm not able to reproduce - Chris - do you still see this issue?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~james-page

comments.content: [Expired for nova (Ubuntu) because there has been no activity for 60 days.]
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~janitor
